title: Lizzo debuts purple locks and sizzles in an orange bodysuit at Austin City Limits
text:
Lizzo has amassed a large and loyal following over the past couple of years, and they showed out in full force Sunday for her performance at Austin City Limits.

She was featured at the music festival among a star-studded lineup, including Cardi B, Billie Eilish and Kacey Musgraves.

The Truth Hurts artist graced the Miller Lite stage Sunday in a sexy superhero chic ensemble.

Superhero chic: Lizzo graced the Miller Lite stage Sunday at Austin City Limits in a sexy superhero chic ensemble

She stepped out in a revealing orange singlet, which showed some skin and hugged her gorgeous curves.

The look featured a structured bustier and red piping, accentuating her hourglass silhouette.

The sexy number included shoulder straps, as well as off-the-shoulder straps hanging down her arms.

She complemented the look with matching orange eyeshadow and lipstick, paired with bright purple hair.

Changing up her look: Lizzo debuted vibrant purple locks as she hit the stage (right: at Radio City Music Hall in New York last month)

Hourglass silhouette: The look featured a structured bustier and red piping, accentuating her hourglass silhouette

Serving body: The sexy number included shoulder straps, as well as off-the-shoulder straps hanging down her arms

It was completed with black fishnets with a pair of black patent leather boots, rounding out the superhero motif.

Although she performed on one of the smaller stages, she drew quite a crowd, which chanted her name as they waited.

She performed some of her most iconic hits, including Jerome, Good as Hell and Truth Hurts.

Purple hair: She complemented the look with matching orange eyeshadow and lipstick, paired with bright purple hair

Fishnets: It was completed with black fishnets with a pair of black patent leather boots, rounding out the superhero motif

Loyal fans: Although she performed on one of the smaller stages, she drew quite a crowd, which chanted her name as they waited. She performed some of her most iconic hits, including Jerome, Good as Hell and Truth Hurts

As the sun went down, the audience pulled out their phones, bathing her in a sea of light.

According to a local news outlet, she inducted attendees into the 'Lizzo Choir,' having them sing 'I’m the one' during her track Soulmate.

She also shouted out some uplifting messages to her fans in between songs, like: 'I want you to leave being happy with who you are.'
description: Lizzo inducted attendees into the 'Lizzo Choir,' having them sing 'I'm the one' during her track Soulmate. She also shouted out some uplifting messages to her fans in between songs.
